name: Impact Tremors
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, Impact Tremors deals 1 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor:
"If their ears are to the ground, we will make them bleed!"
—Taklai, Kolaghan warrior

name: Impaler Shrike
text:
Flying
Whenever Impaler Shrike deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, draw three cards.

editions.flavor:
"Interrogation is an unnecessary step for acquiring information."
—Politus, Gitaxian morphologist

name: Impatience
text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."
Ask a Keldon to hold his temper and you'll be left holding your guts.

name: Impeccable Timing
text: Impeccable Timing deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

editions.flavor: When Baral constructed his trap for Chandra, he did not account for the arrival of an enormous leonin wielding a twin-headed axe.

name: Impelled Giant
text:
Trample
Tap an untapped red creature you control other than Impelled Giant: Impelled Giant gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the power of the creature tapped this way.

name: Impending Disaster
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are seven or more lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Impending Disaster and destroy all lands.

editions.flavor:
"The goblins are in charge of maintenance? Why not just set it on fire now and call it a day?"
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

name: Imperial Edict
text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.

editions.flavor: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emporer Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

name: Imperial Hellkite
text:
Flying
Morph {6}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Imperial Hellkite is turned face up, you may search your library for a Dragon card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Imperial Mask
text:
When Imperial Mask enters the battlefield, if it's not a token, each of your teammates creates a token that's a copy of Imperial Mask.
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

name: Imperial Recruiter
text: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Imperial Seal
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

editions.flavor: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."
"If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

name: Imperiosaur
text: Spend only mana produced by basic lands to cast Imperiosaur.

editions.flavor:
"An ancient, powerful force has overtaken the valley. I sympathize for its former inhabitants, but I rejoice for the land itself."
—Olanti, Muraganda druid

"An ancient, powerful force has overtaken the valley. I sympathize for its former inhabitants, but I rejoice for the land itself."
—Olanti, Muraganda druid

name: Imperious Perfect
text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
editions.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.
In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

name: Impetuous Devils
text:
Trample, haste
When Impetuous Devils attacks, up to one target creature defending player controls blocks it this combat if able.
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Impetuous Devils.

name: Impetuous Sunchaser
text:
Flying, haste
Impetuous Sunchaser attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: "I will soar higher than the walls of Akros! Higher than the clouds! Higher than Heliod himself!"

name: Implement of Combustion
text:
{R}, Sacrifice Implement of Combustion: It deals 1 damage to target player.
When Implement of Combustion is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: A dream of fire lies coiled inside, waiting for its glorious awakening.

name: Implement of Examination
text:
{U}, Sacrifice Implement of Examination: Draw a card.
When Implement of Examination is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: A tool to see the unseen.

name: Implement of Ferocity
text:
{G}, Sacrifice Implement of Ferocity: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Ferocity is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

name: Implement of Improvement
text:
{W}, Sacrifice Implement of Improvement: You gain 2 life.
When Implement of Improvement is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

editions.flavor: A mystery in metal.

name: Implement of Malice
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Implement of Malice: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Implement of Malice is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.

name: Implements of Sacrifice
text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Implements of Sacrifice: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Relics of the Order of the Ebon Hand, the bowl and dagger bespeak the hideous cruelty of its rituals.

name: Implode
text:
Destroy target land.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: To save Dominaria, nine planeswalkers sought the annihilation of Phyrexia itself.

name: Imposing Sovereign
text: Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Some are born to rule. The rest are born to bow before them.

name: Imposing Visage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: With the horrible mask, Lagfrak the Low terrorized the countryside. But then he met Il-Chunt, the mask's model . . . .

"I can't believe they expect me to fight with this rabble. A Goblin in a big mask sends ‘em running for cover."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

name: Imprison
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a player activates an ability of enchanted creature with {T} in its activation cost that isn't a mana ability, you may pay {1}. If you do, counter that ability. If you don't, destroy Imprison.
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, you may pay {1}. If you do, tap the creature, remove it from combat, and creatures it was blocking that had become blocked by only that creature this combat become unblocked. If you don't, destroy Imprison.

name: Imprisoned in the Moon
text:
Enchant creature, land, or planeswalker
Enchanted permanent is a colorless land with "{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool" and loses all other card types and abilities.

editions.flavor: Only one vault was great enough to hold Emrakul.

name: Impromptu Raid
text: {2}{R/G}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it isn't a creature card, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, put that card onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: For the Scuzzback gang, it's always "raid o'clock."

name: Improvised Armor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+5.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: "I trust what I make for myself. Do you trust more what is made for you by another?"

name: Imp's Mischief
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target. You lose life equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Do the innocent pay for the crimes of the guilty? Of course they do. That's the fate of the weak."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Imps' Taunt
text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature attacks this turn if able.

name: Impulse
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi
"You call it luck. I call it preparation."

"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi
"You call it luck. I call it preparation."

name: Impulsive Maneuvers
text: Whenever a creature attacks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, it deals double that damage instead. If you lose the flip, the next time that creature would deal combat damage this turn, prevent that damage.

name: I'm Rubber, You're Glue
text:
Speak only in rhyming sentences. If you do not, sacrifice I'm Rubber, You're Glue.
Say "I'm rubber, you're glue. Everything bounces off me and sticks to you": Target spell or ability, which targets only you, targets another player of your choice instead. (The new target must be legal.)

name: Inaction Injunction
text:
Detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"To prevent action is to prevent transgression."
—Azorius Arrester motto

name: Iname as One
text:
When Iname as One enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, you may search your library for a Spirit permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
When Iname as One dies, you may exile it. If you do, return target Spirit permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Iname, Death Aspect
text: When Iname, Death Aspect enters the battlefield, you may search your library for any number of Spirit cards and put them into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: Iname revels in sadistic glee at the crushing of souls, but soon mourns the lives so cruelly cut short. So the cycle begins anew.

name: Iname, Life Aspect
text: When Iname, Life Aspect dies, you may exile it. If you do, return any number of target Spirit cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Iname rejoices in the dawn of a new life, but soon becomes jealous of the simple joys denied him by his station. So the cycle begins anew.

name: Incandescent Soulstoke
text:
Other Elemental creatures you control get +1/+1.
{1}{R}, {T}: You may put an Elemental creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Incendiary
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fuse counter on Incendiary.
When enchanted creature dies, Incendiary deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of fuse counters on Incendiary.

name: Incendiary Command
text:
Choose two —
• Incendiary Command deals 4 damage to target player.
• Incendiary Command deals 2 damage to each creature.
• Destroy target nonbasic land.
• Each player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

name: Incendiary Dissent
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Creatures you control with the chosen name have "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

name: Incendiary Flow
text: Incendiary Flow deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

editions.flavor:
"What's your plan?" Gideon asked.
"Are you serious?" Chandra replied.

name: Incendiary Sabotage
text:
As an additional cost to cast Incendiary Sabotage, sacrifice an artifact.
Incendiary Sabotage deals 3 damage to each creature.

editions.flavor: "All of those Consulate safety measures undone with one simple tweak."

name: Incinerate
text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

"Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Incite
text: Target creature becomes red until end of turn and attacks this turn if able.

editions.flavor: The veneer of rationality peeled from the mage, revealing the spite and rage beneath.

name: Incited Rabble
text:
Incited Rabble attacks each combat if able.
{2}: Incited Rabble gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Rumors are sparks: gather enough of them and something's going to catch fire.

name: Incite Hysteria
text: Radiance — Until end of turn, target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it gain "This creature can't block."

editions.flavor:
"The Boros say they want to bring order to Ravnica. Funny then, how well they use chaos."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

name: Incite Rebellion
text: For each player, Incite Rebellion deals damage to that player and each creature that player controls equal to the number of creatures he or she controls.

editions.flavor: Nothing breaks the monotony like a good old-fashioned riot.

name: Incite War
text:
Choose one —
• Creatures target player controls attack this turn if able.
• Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Incoming!
text: Each player searches his or her library for any number of artifacts, creatures, enchantments, and lands and puts those cards into play. Each player shuffles his or her library afterwards.

name: Incorrigible Youths
text:
Haste
Madness {2}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor:
"Ah, to be young again."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Increasing Ambition
text:
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. If Increasing Ambition was cast from a graveyard, instead search your library for two cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {7}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Increasing Confusion
text:
Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If Increasing Confusion was cast from a graveyard, that player puts twice that many cards into his or her graveyard instead.
Flashback {X}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Increasing Devotion
text:
Create five 1/1 white Human creature tokens. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, create ten of those tokens instead.
Flashback {7}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Increasing Savagery
text:
Put five +1/+1 counters on target creature. If Increasing Savagery was cast from a graveyard, put ten +1/+1 counters on that creature instead.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Increasing Vengeance
text:
Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Flashback {3}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Incremental Blight
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, two -1/-1 counters on another target creature, and three -1/-1 counters on a third target creature.

editions.flavor: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.
Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.
Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.

name: Incremental Growth
text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, two +1/+1 counters on another target creature, and three +1/+1 counters on a third target creature.

editions.flavor:
"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."
—Kithkin superstition
The bonds of family cross the boundaries of race.

"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."
—Kithkin superstition

"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."

name: Incubator Drone
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
When Incubator Drone enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature token. It has "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: The touch of an Eldrazi brings life and death in turn.
Each mutation causes the incurables to look vastly different from one another. They are left with only one thing in common: their insatiable lust for the slaughter.

name: Incursion Specialist
text: Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, Incursion Specialist gets +2/+0 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: "Work for the Dimir again? That depends. Tell me more about this maze."

name: Indebted Samurai
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.

editions.flavor: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."

name: Indentured Djinn
text:
Flying
When Indentured Djinn enters the battlefield, each other player may draw up to three cards.

editions.flavor: It's not always clear who's the master and who's the servant.

name: Indentured Oaf
text: Prevent all damage that Indentured Oaf would deal to red creatures.

editions.flavor: All it knows is the difference between friend and food.
"The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

name: Indestructibility
text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

editions.flavor: "By all means, keep trying."

name: Indestructible Aura
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

editions.flavor: Theodar strode the battle lines, snatching swords with his bare hands and casting them aside until all cowered before him.
Theodar strode the battle lines, snatching swords with his bare hands and casting them aside until all cowered before him.

name: Index
text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

editions.flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."
"Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."
"What good is having all the right answers if you have them at all the wrong times?"
"Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."

name: Indigo Faerie
text:
Flying
{U}: Target permanent becomes blue in addition to its other colors until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "You should see your face right now."

"Odum and Broadbark were the only beings mighty enough to challenge the giant Moran the Destroyer. Their battle lasted a hundred dawns, until Moran became so exhausted that he fell into namesleep. He awoke as Moran the Gardener."
—The Tale of Odum and Broadbark

name: Indomitable Archangel
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — Artifacts you control have shroud as long as you control three or more artifacts. (An artifact with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor:
"Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand."
—Auriok proverb

"Every sword drawn to defend is an angelic blade, guided to justice by an angelic hand."
—Auriok proverb

name: Indomitable Creativity
text: Destroy X target artifacts and/or creatures. For each permanent destroyed this way, its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until an artifact or creature card is revealed and exiles that card. Those players put the exiled cards onto the battlefield, then shuffle their libraries.

name: Indomitable Will
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

editions.flavor:
"None of you are yet samurai. Defend your homes with honor, die for your cause, and perhaps then you will be worthy of the word."
—General Takeno

name: Indrik Stomphowler
text: When Indrik Stomphowler enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: An indrik's howl has destructive power much subtler than that of its crushing foot.

—Simic research notes

text:

Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Induce Despair
text:
As an additional cost to cast Induce Despair, reveal a creature card from your hand.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the revealed card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: All the angel saw was her doom.
All the angel saw was her doom.

name: Induce Paranoia
text: Counter target spell. If {B} was spent to cast Induce Paranoia, that spell's controller puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the spell's converted mana cost.

name: Indulgent Aristocrat
text:
Lifelink
{2}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on each Vampire you control.

editions.flavor: "If you're not surrounded by decadence, my question to you is—why not?"

name: Indulgent Tormentor
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card unless target opponent sacrifices a creature or pays 3 life.

editions.flavor: The promise of anguish is payment enough for services rendered.

name: Inertia Bubble
text:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor:
"I wouldn't want you to hurt yourself."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader

name: Inescapable Brute
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Inescapable Brute must be blocked if able.

editions.flavor: If you think you made it past him alive, he's just teasing you.

name: Inexorable Blob
text: Delirium — Whenever Inexorable Blob attacks, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, create a 3/3 green Ooze creature token that's tapped and attacking.

name: Inexorable Tide
text: Whenever you cast a spell, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

editions.flavor:
"See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

"See how gratefully this world accepts our blessings."

name: Infantry Veteran
text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "This scar? From a zombie's teeth. This scar? From a barbarian's axe. That scar? I don't talk about that one."

"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

text:
{2}{B}: Infected Vermin deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

Enchant creature

Enchant player

text:
Enchant creature

name: Infernal Denizen
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice two Swamps. If you can't, tap Infernal Denizen, and an opponent may gain control of a creature you control of his or her choice for as long as Infernal Denizen remains on the battlefield.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as Infernal Denizen remains on the battlefield.

name: Infernal Genesis
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then he or she creates X 1/1 black Minion creature tokens, where X is that card's converted mana cost.

name: Infernal Harvest
text:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Harvest, return X Swamps you control to their owner's hand.
Infernal Harvest deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say where."
—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Infernal Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: The kirin bellowed—an echoing, twisted parody of its once-inspirational call.

name: Infernal Medusa
text:
Whenever Infernal Medusa blocks a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Whenever Infernal Medusa becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

name: Infernal Offering
text:
Choose an opponent. You and that player each sacrifice a creature. Each player who sacrificed a creature this way draws two cards.
Choose an opponent. Return a creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield, then that player returns a creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

name: Infernal Plunge
text:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Plunge, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"
